banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: How I bring imagined worlds to life
videoData.socialTitle: How I bring imagined worlds to life

nodes.whoTheyAre: Gemma Jackson is a production designer for film and television.

videoData.description: When we think about a movie or TV show's unique visuals, we tend to associate it with directors or cinematographers. But who picks the furniture that sits in your favorite character's home -- or decides whether a palace is brutalist or minimalist? In this eye-opening talk, "Game of Thrones" production designer Gemma Jackson explains what goes into plucking fictional worlds out of scripts and willing them into physical reality.
videoData.socialDescription: When we think about a movie or TV show's unique visuals, we tend to associate it with directors or cinematographers. But who picks the furniture that sits in your favorite character's home -- or decides whether a palace is brutalist or minimalist? In this eye-opening talk, "Game of Thrones" production designer Gemma Jackson explains what goes into plucking fictional worlds out of scripts and willing them into physical reality.
